alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 16 at 3:36PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Whiteside, Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. Rock River at Moline affecting Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rock River near Joslin. * WHEN...From late Friday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding of unprotected agricultural land occurs. Water also affects Lundeens Landing Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this evening.
